entry.string: Administration - SiteContact
What is it?

SiteContact is a simple module that allows visitors to easily contact the Site Administrator by email. The module allows you to setup one or more forms with different fields and configurations using dynamic data. It comes preinstalled with one default Contact Form.
Administrators can also allow form responses to be saved to the database
How to use it?

Install SiteContact as usual from the administration Module listing. There is one table (sitecontact) currently used to hold different contact form definitions. Then, setup the module configuration in Modify Config option.
Sitecontact is ready to go. You can use the default form without any further configuration. If you want to configure your default contact form, or create further forms, review the following.
Using and Customizing Display and Email Forms
By default, a user will be able to see the Default Form that you have configured for your site (see ModifyConfig options below). If no sitecontact form is specified in a URL the default form is used.
You can provide a link to any form by appending the form name variable called:
scform
and a form name, for example 'myniceform', to the main user url eg
index.php?module=sitecontact&scform=myniceform
or with short urls
index.php/sitecontact/myniceform
All forms will use the default display template (
user-main.xd
) for display of the form on your site. You can also create custom templates with the name of your form appended to the end (user-main-
myform
.xd). Form templates can be overridden in your theme as per other Xaraya templates (eg create
user-main-myform.xt
in your themes/yourtheme/modules/sitecontact directory), and will fall back to the default template if no others exist.
You can also create override templates that are used to send the emails to Admins of your site, or the users when they request a copy of the email. Each has both a HTML and TEXT template. The
admin
default html and text email templates are
user-adminmail-html.xd
and
user-adminmail-text.xd
respectively. The
user
templates are
user-usermail-html.xd
user-usermail-text.xd
respectively. Override them in your theme.
You can go further and create custom email templates for html and text for each FORM. eg if your form is called
basic
you can create an override text email template called
user-usermail-html-basic.xt
Manage Custom Contact Forms
Â

This option allows you to create new forms, modify, delete and preview existing ones. Sitecontact is installed with a default 'basic' form that you can start to use immediately. Read below for the configuration options.
You can create new forms that will initially have configuration settings populated with the default values that you have set in the global Modify Config option (see below).
Options available in the Global Modify Configuration can be overridden by editing the specific custom form options.
Modify Configuration (Global Configuration)

There are a number of variables you can set in the Modify Config option. These options are preset on install but you can change them. They are the GLOBAL options for sitecontact and will be used by default for all *new* contact forms that you create.
Check the Short URL checkbox to use short urls
entry.translation: Zur Verwendung von ShortUrls die Option auswÃ¤hlen

entry.string: You should set a
Default Form
for use on your site when no other forms are specified.

You can use HTML in your emails or in the configurable text that displays in SiteContact pages. But, please, if you do, make sure you have HTML allowed in your site by configuring the HTML module to use the HTML tags you wish to use.

Stellen Sie aber bitte sicher, dass Sie die Verwendung von HTML auf Ihrer Website gestattet haben. Dies tun Sie mithilfe des Moduls "HTML", mit dem Sie die Verwendung gewÃ¼nschten HTML-Tags freigeben kÃ¶nnen.

entry.string: Note that you
can
use HTML email in Sitecontact by checking the
Use HTML Email
option in the SiteContact configuration. This will allow HTML mail just for Sitecontact module, even if your default mail setup is text.

By default, all emails are sent to the administrator email address specified in the Mail module. You can override this for each of the Subject options of your feedback form. Just add the subject option and alternative email in the form:
entry.translation: StandardmÃ¤Ãig werden alle E-Mails an die Mailadresse des Administrators gesandt, die im "Mail"-Modul festgelegt wurde. Sie kÃ¶nnen diese allerdings fÃ¼r jede Betreff-Option Ihres Feedback-Formulars Ã¼berschreiben. Sie mÃ¼ssen nur die Betreff-Option und Mailadresse im Formular hinzufÃ¼gen:

entry.string: Subject-line
optional-email
The line
must end with a comma
. The semi-colon and optional email can be omitted. Don't forget to test your setup by sending yourself an email through SiteContact!

The HTML and text emails that are sent to the website contact (admin or other) and the user are based on templates in the module's xartemplate directory. There is a text and an HTML version for both the Admin notification email (user-adminmail-text.xd and user-adminmail-html.xd) and the user (user- usermail-text.xd and user-usermail-html.xd).
entry.translation: Die HTML- und Text-E-Mails, die an den Website-Kontakt (Admin oder andere) und die Nutzer gesendet werden, basieren auf den Templates (Vorlagen) im xartemplate-Ordner des "SiteContact"-Moduls. Es gibt eine Text- und eine HTML-Version sowohl fÃ¼r die Benachrichtigungsmail an den Administrator (user-adminmail-text.xd und user-adminmail-html.xd) als auch an den Nutzer (user- usermail-text.xd und user-usermail-html.xd).

entry.string: Allow copy to sender
- if checked, will allow logged in users on your site to send themselves a copy of their form data by email.
Allow anonymous users to request a copy
- if checked, will allow anonymous users to send themselves a copy of their form data by email, if the Allow Copy to Sender checkbox is also checked.
CC or BC to other Recipients

You can configure your forms with a list of CC or BC recipients from the configuration for each form. The CC and BC fields take a list of recipient emails and optionally a name for each. These emails and names must be in the correct format. Make sure you understand the
POTENTIAL PROBLEMS

of adding these fields to your forms on an open access website where potential spammers can gain access! It is an option best kept protected by using Site Contact permissions for trusted user groups on your site. Keep in mind the following:
If you have a list of email addresses, separate each by a semicolon (;) eg
person1@somedomain.com;person2@anotherdomain.com
If you have a list of email addresses and optional names, separate the name from the email addres with a comma eg
person1@somedomain.com,name1;person2@anotherdomain.com,name2
NOTE: CC and BC do not work with Windows and the mail() function. They both should work with SMTP mail.
Extend Forms with Dynamic Data
Hook Dynamic Data to Site Contact forms
for either individual forms or all of them and setup your custom dynamic data property fields for each of your sitecontact forms. Your Dynamic Data fields will be
included by default
in display templates or outgoing emails - no need to add them manually if you use the default sitecontact system template.

You can customize the dynamic data output in the respective user display templates, and the email templates. It is recommended you copy the default system template and edit that, so you can see how the dynamic data is added in the template. You can also
remove
fields that you do not want displayed by editing the templates, or retemplate their output. Who said simple modules aren't powerful :)
Adding An Attachment
You can add a Dynamic Data field to your form to allow users to add an Attachment to their email. To do:
Make sure you
do
have Dynamic Data hooked, but
do not
have the Uploads module hooked to your Site contact form
Add a Dynamic Data property of type
File Upload
to your form. This will provide the attachment field.
Once you add and save the DD field, ensure you set the Configuration for this File Upload field type. Add something like:
var/uploads/resumes;(doc|jpg|tar.gz|zip);1000000
In this example the attachment will be temporarily uploaded to the
var/uploads/resume
directory but deleted once the email has been sent. Make sure this temporary upload directory is writeable.
Saving SiteContact Forms

Sitecontact allows administrators to choose form responses to be saved to their database. There is also an option available to Administrators to allow users to give their permission to save data to the database. In this case, the contact forms are still emailed but data will only be saved if user explicitly checks the permission checkbox. Users must have comment level access to the form to have the data saved else they can only read and submit the form.
SiteContact Permissions
Sitecontact provides Xaraya permissions to manage user access to your forms. You can provide access to users for all forms, or for specific form instances.
Read Level Access - allows filling out a form and emailing it.
Comment Level Access - allows filling out a form and emailing it and also saving the form to the database, if you have activated this option for this form.
Edit Level Access - for All forms, allows editing and modification of form configuration.
Admin Level Access - for All forms, allows all administration functions for your forms.
Included Blocks
Sitecontact Block

: allows choice of one of the active forms for display in a block on your site. The block requires at least Read level (ReadBlock) privileges for viewing, and is privilege aware using Block privileges. This means you can selectively apply privileges for the given block by creating a Blocks module privilege on the Sitecontact block.
Further Information
Further information on the Sitecontact module can be found at
Sitecontact Extension page at
